Understanding Text Structure: A Hunter's Guide

What is text structure? Text structure is how an author organizes information in a piece of writing. Different types of texts use different structures:

  • Poems - Use stanzas, rhyme schemes, and rhythm patterns
  • Stories - Use beginning, middle, end; exposition, rising action, climax, falling action, resolution
  • Informational texts - Use cause/effect, compare/contrast, problem/solution, chronological order

Dungeon Raid

Official Quest Instructions

Students will independently read the following poem and story. After which they will complete the following questions demonstrating their understanding of text structure.

Your Quest Materials

Poem Structure - Read this poem Poem Questions - Complete these questions Story Structure - Read this story Story Questions - Complete these questions

Raid Strategy Guide

Step 1: Read the Poem First

Read through the poem once without stopping. Get a feel for the overall message and mood.

Step 2: Analyze Poem Structure

Read again and identify:
- How many stanzas are there?
- What is the rhyme scheme? (ABAB, AABB, etc.)
- How does each stanza contribute to the overall meaning?

Step 3: Answer Poem Questions

Complete the Poem Questions worksheet, referencing specific parts of the text in your answers.

Step 4: Read the Story

Read the story and identify the major structural elements: beginning, middle, and end.

Step 5: Analyze Story Structure

Identify:
- The exposition (introduction of characters/setting)
- The rising action (building tension)
- The climax (turning point)
- The resolution (how it ends)

Step 6: Complete Story Questions

Answer all questions about how the story's structure contributes to its meaning.
